author: Joshua Barrie
title: The reasons your deodorant might not be working - and how to make sure you don't smell
text:
Do you smell? (Photo: Corbis RM Stills) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
Nobody wants to smell bad. And, no doubt, deodorant is a decent way to ensure that throughout the day, you stay fresh. Or at least mask your body's odours. 
But, sometimes, do you feel let down by your fragrance? Come 6pm, while you travel home, or you think, "oh, maybe I'll try a different brand". 
Well, it might not be your deodorant at all. You might be just doing it wrong, and minimising the formula's effectiveness. 
There are some seriously common mistakes when it comes to preventing sweating and odour. And these changes might help you stay clean longer. Sally has a date and wants to be fresh (Photo: Onoky) There's a difference between deodorant and antiperspirant 
Antiperspirants help to reduce sweating, combating the root cause. Deodorants imply masks smells – it covers the surface as a quick fix. Deodorant might be a quick way to sort yourself out at work, but antiperspirant is probably better in the morning. Wet skin 
Don't apply straight out of the shower. You need your armpits to be completely free of moisture before putting on deodorant or antiperspirant, as they only work properly if put on dry skin. Shaving Your body needs a break (Photo: Digital Vision) Read More 
Applying what are essentially chemicals to irritated, sensitive skin is a bad idea. If nothing more, you'll just sting yourself. Don't add and add 
Layering fragrances might seem like a good idea, but it's not. You need to apply products to clean skin – simply putting deodorant on top of deodorant isn't really going to actually help you if a pong has arrived. Applying at night Wait until you're dry to put on a fragrance (Photo: The Image Bank) 
If you want to tool up properly, applying at night time is a neat trick, according to beauty experts. Antiperspirants take a while to kick in (a few hours), so if you put it on in the morning, then move around a lot, you might bring about some sweat. Moisturise your armpits 
It might sound weird, but like the rest of your skin, your pits need some TLC. By keeping them hydrated, they'll stay healthier, and are less likely to smell. Like us on Facebook
